title: PE back at NAB's MLC as separation nears
text:
Private equity knives are out for National Australia Bank's MLC.

As NAB gets closer to getting through the mountain of work required to internally separate its wealth management arm, private equity dealmakers have stepped up their calculations on the business.

Leveraged finance bankers are known to have been asked to look at all sorts of funding scenarios for an MLC buyout, ranging from vanilla bank debt to more complex securitisation-backed deals.

Sources said the most interest was coming from offshore: MLC would be too big a bite for most of the domestic firms with close to $200 billion in assets and about $200 million a year in cash earnings.

It's one of those situations Street Talk would not be surprised see come to a head in coming months. NAB says it's not engaged with any bidders but MLC has a few things going for it in private equity's eyes.
description: Private equity knives are out for National Australia Bank's MLC.
